title: Monet in London
creator_credit: David Thompson, Arts Council of Great Britain and Balfour Films
brief_description: Presents the work of French painter Claude Monet during the period 1889 to 1901 when he lived in London. Shows the painter’s views of London, including Charing Cross Bridge, Waterloo Bridge, and St. Thomas’ Hospital, accompanied by readings from his diaries and letters.
